newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-WHITE SOX PLACE FRANK THOMAS ON DISABLED LIST.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-WHITE SOX PLACE FRANK THOMAS ON DISABLED LIST.

text.p: First baseman Frank Thomas, the leading hitter in the American League, was placed on the 15-day disabled list Sunday by the Chicago White Sox, retroactive to June 7.
Thomas, who has missed the last seven games with a strained rib cage muscle, suffered the injury during Chicago's 7-3 victory over the Baltimore Orioles on June 6.
The White Sox have struggled since he left the lineup, winning two of seven games prior to Sunday. Their offence has been anaemic without the "Big Hurt," totalling just 14 runs during that span.
This is just the second time Thomas has been forced to the disabled list. The 29-year-old slugger missed time last year with a stress fracture of the left foot.
Thomas leads the American League with a .391 batting average, and also has 16 homers and 55 RBI.
